text: <@UHVJJUWFN> I suppose the main thing that is needed is for any of the runs that fail to be retried after a brief delay. They get retried, but stop retrying before the retry would be effective. At least, I believe that's what I was seeing. For the moment, we discontinued this project because of this issue.
A fun update here: we figured this out finally!
I also figured out why my actions wasn't working.

• Cause:
    ◦ SDK unexpected behavior compared to API endpoints
    ◦ outputFields not being created when request sent via create-action script due to missing required fields inside the “outputFields” schema
• Solution:
    ◦ Using API calls instead of SDK
    ◦ Adding missing fields to the “outputFields” schema
    ◦ Needs to be applied to every action request object
        ▪︎ hubdbRead.js
        ▪︎ hubdbWrite.js
        ▪︎ hubdbUpdate.js
my action was missing the outputFields definition.

After we updated our action, it now has all the response to be able to branch. Instead of a string/number we did a enumeration. So instead of the end user always having to remember the response from the action. :smile:
I sent Julian a response back on July 17 with that solution! So I hoped that help yall
Nice! That's fantastic! Sounds like we had a bit of a similar missing piece :stuck_out_tongue_winking_eye:

I like the enumeration option - so easy to use for folks building the workflows.

Thank you for the tip! I think it got us going in the right direction :pray:
yes Carter, we updated our workflow action to provide better contextual responses based on the event and the contact the person is trying to register.
Looks like this might handle live webinars - is this using something like Zoom to handle the audio/visual piece?
